description: A cavewoman points towards a group of large prehistoric animals standing outside a cave entrance, instructing a caveman to bring them in. The irony lies in the casual request for "frozen dinners" when referring to live, potentially dangerous creatures like a woolly mammoth, a sabre-toothed cat, and a wart hog-like beast. This juxtaposition of modern convenience (frozen dinners) with the harsh reality of prehistoric survival creates a surreal and absurd scenario. The animals stand passively, enhancing the bizarre notion of them being readily available food items. The scene presents a novel situation where powerful ancient creatures are reduced to the equivalent of packaged meals.
caption: "And while you're out there, bring in a couple of them frozen dinners."
